newsitem.title: UK: Premier edges higher after press comment.
newsitem.headline: Premier edges higher after press comment.

text.p: Shares in British oil and gas exploration and production company Premier Oil Plc crept higher on Tuesday after positive comment by an analyst in a British Sunday newspaper, market makers said.
Credit Lyonnais analyst Jurgen Lunshoff forecast the group's shares to double from their present value in 12 months and called the company "very underrated", the Mail on Sunday newspaper said.
The stock was 1-1/4p higher at 37-1/2p by 1315 GMT, having touched a high of 43 on January 15 this year.
"(Lunshoff)says the big oil groups want cheap routes into North Sea production, and Premier is one of the few still available," the newspaper said.
Analysts said the reaction was muted, however, as Lunshoff was merely reiterating a previous recommendation.
"He(Lunshoff) has always been quite keen on Premier, so he wasn't really saying anything new," said another analyst at Credit Lyonnais.
The newspaper said Lunshoff also remained bullish about bigger British oil groups like Enterprise Oil and Lasmo, but rated Burmah Castrol as a "sell".
